member.name: T:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.License
member.summary: Provides methods to license the component.
member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains
the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As license = New license License.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")

member.name: M:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.License.SetLicense(System.String)
member.summary: Licenses the component.

remarks.p: Tries to find the license in the following locations:
2. The folder that contains the Aspose component assembly.
3. The folder that contains the client's calling assembly.
4. The folder that contains the entry (startup) assembly.
5. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.
Note:On the .NET Compact Framework, tries to find the license only in these locations:
2. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.

member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains
the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As License = New License license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic") Can be a full or short file name or name of an embedded resource. Use an empty string to switch to evaluation mode.

member.name: M:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.License.SetLicense(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Licenses the component.
member.param: A stream that contains the license.

remarks.p: Use this method to load a license from a stream.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.License.IsLicensed
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether product is licensed.
member.value: true if product is licensed; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition contains tools for the 1D/2D barcodes recognition.

member.name: T:Aspose.BarCode.Recognition.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition contains tools for the 1D/2D barcodes recognition.

summary.para: Enable checksum validation during recognition for 1D barcodes.
Default is treated as Yes for symbologies which must contain checksum, as No where checksum only possible.
Checksum never used: Codabar
Checksum is possible: Code39 Standard/Extended, Standard2of5, Interleaved2of5, Matrix2of5, ItalianPost25, DeutschePostIdentcode, DeutschePostLeitcode, VIN
Checksum always used: Rest symbologies

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.ChecksumValidation.Default
member.summary: If checksum is required by the specification - it will be validated.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.ChecksumValidation.On
member.summary: Always validate checksum if possible.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.ChecksumValidation.Off
member.summary: Do not validate checksum.

summary.para: Enable checksum validation during recognition for 1D barcodes.
Default is treated as Yes for symbologies which must contain checksum, as No where checksum only possible.
Checksum never used: Codabar
Checksum is possible: Code39 Standard/Extended, Standard2of5, Interleaved2of5, Matrix2of5, ItalianPost25, DeutschePostIdentcode, DeutschePostLeitcode, VIN
Checksum always used: Rest symbologies

member.name: T:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.ManualHint
member.summary: Manual hints.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.ManualHint.None
member.summary: There are no heavy recognition algorithms. The fastest recognition algorithms are used there, however if image is noisy recognition will fail. Used by default.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.ManualHint.InvertImage
member.summary: Use when image is white on black background. Typically BarCode images are black on white background.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.ManualHint.IncorrectBarcodes
member.summary: Addition algorithms are included to recognize incorrectly generated or damaged barcodes (skipped bars, stop symbol, etc). May return deniable recognition.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.ManualHint.ComplexBackground
member.summary: Analyzes barcode background. Useful with complex or colored backgrounds.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.ManualHint.MedianSmoothing
member.summary: MedianSmoothing. Works with BarcodeReader's MedianSmoothingWindowSize property. The MaxQuality mode includes this flag by default.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.ManualHint.UseRestoration
member.summary: Starts recognition using only the restoration algorithms from MaxQuality mode.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.ManualHint.UseRegular
member.summary: Starts recognition using algorithms from MaxPerfomance mode. Useful to combine with other hints.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.ManualHint.SpecialFormOfCells
member.summary: Starts recognition barcodes with the special form of cells. Example: dot peen Datamatrix. The MaxQuality mode includes this flag by default.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.ManualHint.SkipRotatedBarcodes
member.summary: Switches off algorithms of rotating and so increases the recognition speed. It works only for Datamatrix and linear barcodes.

member.name: T:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.RecognitionHints
member.summary: Set recognition hints here.

member.name: T:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.RecognitionHints.Orientation
member.summary: Orientation hints.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.RecognitionHints.Orientation.NoRotate
member.summary: No rotation.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.RecognitionHints.Orientation.Rotate90
member.summary: Rotate image by 90 degress clockwise.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.RecognitionHints.Orientation.Rotate180
member.summary: Rotate image by 180 degress clockwise.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.RecognitionHints.Orientation.Rotate270
member.summary: Rotate image by 270 degress clockwise.

member.name: T:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.RecognitionHints.ImageBinarization
member.summary: Image binarization hints.

member.summary: Default value used.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.RecognitionHints.ImageBinarization.MedianSmoothing
member.summary: Median smoothing. Works with BarcodeReader's MedianSmoothingWindowSize property.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.RecognitionHints.ImageBinarization.InvertImage
member.summary: Invert image.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.RecognitionHints.ImageBinarization.ComplexBackground
member.summary: Background analyze. Useful with complex or colored background.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.RecognitionHints.ImageBinarization.LineCodesRestoration
member.summary: This filter restores corrupted strokes for 1D barcodes. This degradation could come from dirty, dusty products or discarded barcode resulting in touched or missing parts of bars.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.RecognitionHints.ImageBinarization.IncorrectBarcodes
member.summary: Recognize incorrect generated barcodes (skipped stop symbol, etc).

member.name: T:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.RecognitionMode
member.summary: Recognition modes. Note: only one recognition mode can be selected.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.RecognitionMode.MaxPerformance
member.summary: Finds all the possible good and average quality barcodes. Uses only the fastest algorithms. Enabled by default.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.RecognitionMode.MaxQuality
member.summary: Finds all the possible barcodes with good or bad quality. Doesn't return potential barcodes. Uses different fast and slow algorithms.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.RecognitionMode.MaxBarCodes
member.summary: Extends MaxQuality. Finds even potential barcodes. Uses extra algorithms which may recognize incorrect barcodes, barcodes on complex background, noisy or damaged barcodes and etc. You may observe extra spurious barcodes.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.RecognitionMode.ManualHints
member.summary: User configures hints optionally. Allows you to adjust the balance between speed and quality manually.

summary.para: Enable checksum during generation for 1D barcodes.
Default is treated as Yes for symbologies which must contain checksum, as No where checksum only possible.
Checksum never used: Codabar
Checksum is possible: Code39 Standard/Extended, Standard2of5, Interleaved2of5, Matrix2of5, ItalianPost25, DeutschePostIdentcode, DeutschePostLeitcode, VIN
Checksum always used: Rest symbologies

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.EnableChecksum.Default
member.summary: If checksum is required by the specification - it will be attached.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.EnableChecksum.Yes
member.summary: Always use checksum if possible.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.EnableChecksum.No
member.summary: Do not use checksum.

member.name: T:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.QREncodeMode
member.summary: Encoding mode for QR barcodes. It is recommended to Use Auto with CodeTextEncoding = Encoding.UTF8 for Latin symbols or digits and Utf8BOM for Unicode symbols.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.QREncodeMode.Auto
member.summary: Encode codetext as is non-Unicode charset. If there is any Unicode character, the codetext will be encoded with value which is set in CodeTextEncoding.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.QREncodeMode.Bytes
member.summary: Encode codetext as plain bytes. If it detects any Unicode character, the character will be encoded as two bytes, lower byte first.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.QREncodeMode.Utf8BOM
member.summary: Encode codetext with UTF8 encoding with first ByteOfMark character.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.QREncodeMode.Utf16BEBOM
member.summary: Encode codetext with UTF8 encoding with first ByteOfMark character. It can be problems with some barcode scanners.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.QREncodeMode.ECIEncoding
member.summary: Encode codetext with value set in the ECIEncoding property. It can be problems with some old (pre 2006) barcode scanners.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.QREncodeMode.ExtendedCodetext

summary.para: Extended Channel mode which supports FNC1 first position, FNC1 second position and multi ECI modes.
It is better to use QrExtCodetextBuilder for extended codetext generation.
Use Display2DText property to set visible text to removing managing characters.
Encoding Principles:
All symbols "\" must be doubled "\\" in the codetext.
FNC1 in first position is set in codetext as as "<FNC1>"
FNC1 in second position is set in codetext as as "<FNC1(value)>". The value must be single symbols (a-z, A-Z) or digits from 0 to 99.
Group Separator for FNC1 modes is set as 0x1D character '\u001D'
If you need to insert "<FNC1>" string into barcode write it as "<\FNC1>"
ECI identifiers are set as single slash and six digits identifier "\000026" - UTF8 ECI identifier
TO disable current ECI mode and convert to default JIS8 mode zero mode ECI indetifier is set. "\000000"
All unicode characters after ECI identifier are automatically encoded into correct character codeset.

member.name: T:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.QREncodeType
member.summary: QR / MicroQR selector mode. Select ForceQR for standard QR symbols, Auto for MicroQR. ForceMicroQR is used for strongly MicroQR symbol generation if it is possible.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.QREncodeType.Auto
member.summary: Mode starts barcode version negotiation from MicroQR V1

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.QREncodeType.ForceQR
member.summary: Mode starts barcode version negotiation from QR V1

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.QREncodeType.ForceMicroQR
member.summary: Mode starts barcode version negotiation from from MicroQR V1 to V4. If data cannot be encoded into MicroQR, exception is thrown.

If the EnableEscape is true, "\" will be explained as a special escape character. Otherwise, "\" acts as normal characters.Aspose.BarCode supports inputing decimal ascii code and mnemonic for ASCII control-code characters. For example, \013 and \CR stands for CR.

member.summary: x-dimension is the smallest width of the unit of BarCode bars or spaces. increase this will increase the whole barcode image width if AutoSize is true Default Graphics Unit: Millimeter See . See . See .

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.BarCodeBuilder.yDimension
member.summary:
y-dimension, smallest height unit of 2D BarCode's modules. Some square symbols (such as DataMatrix) may ignore this and use x-dimension for both width unit and height unit
In 2D barcode, y-dimension * rows determines BarCode's height In 1D barcode, BarHeight determines BarCode's height. Default Graphics Unit: Millimeter See . See .

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.BarCodeBuilder.BarHeight
member.summary: height of 1D barcodes' bars. In 2D barcode, y-dimension * rows determines BarCode's height In 1D barcode, BarHeight determines BarCode's height. Default Graphics Unit: Millimeter See .

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.BarCodeBuilder.AspectRatio
member.summary: height/width ratio (yDimension/xDimension) of 2D BarCode module. calculated based on xDimension set to 0 means not using this feature. See . See .
member.remarks: Some 2D BarCodes are square shaped, then AspectRatio is not applicable

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.BarCodeBuilder.Margins
member.summary: Margin area around the core BarCode image If AutoSize is false, then Width and Height is fixed, thus Margins setting will be ignored Default Graphics Unit: Millimeter

member.summary: Short bar's height of Postnet barcode, it has to be between 1 millimeter and 1.5 millimeter (0.04 inch and 0.06 inch). To set up tall bar's height, see BarHeight, which has to be between 8.28 milimeter and 9.72 milimeter (0.115 inch and 0.135 inch) see changing See GraphicsUnit. see setting tall bar's height: See BarHeight.

summary.para: Enable checksum during generation for 1D barcodes.
Default is treated as Yes for symbology which must contain checksum, as No where checksum only possible.
Checksum never used: Codabar
Checksum is possible: Code39 Standard/Extended, Standard2of5, Interleaved2of5, Matrix2of5, ItalianPost25, DeutschePostIdentcode, DeutschePostLeitcode, VIN
Checksum always used: Rest symbology

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.BarCodeBuilder.ThrowExceptionWhenCodeTextIncorrect
member.summary: Only for 1D barcodes. If codetext is incorrect and value set to true - exception will be thrown. Otherwise codetext will be corrected to match barcode's specification. Exception always will be thrown for: Databar symbology if codetext is incorrect. Exception always will not be thrown for: AustraliaPost, SingapurePost, Code39Extended, Code93Extended, Code16K, Code128 symbology if codetext is incorrect.

member.name: T:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.MarginsF
member.summary: Specifies the margins of a barcode image.

remarks.p: This class is used to manipulate margins in barcode image.
Note : The actual amount of the margins are determined by the specified mesure unit of the barcode image.
MarginsFConverter is the type descriptor for this class.
Left, Right, Top, and Bottom are properties that define the margins.
Equals determines if another object is equal to a MarginsF object.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.Symbology.UpcaGs1Code128Coupon
member.summary: Specifies that the data should be encoded with UPC coupon with GS1-128 Extended Code barcode specification. An example of the input string: BarCodeBuilder.Codetext = "514141100906(8102)03", where UPCA part is "514141100906", GS1Code128 part is (8102)03.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.Symbology.UpcaGs1DatabarCoupon
member.summary: Specifies that the data should be encoded with UPC coupon with GS1 DataBar addition barcode specification. An example of the input string: BarCodeBuilder.Codetext = "514141100906(8110)106141416543213500110000310123196000", where UPCA part is "514141100906", Databar part is "(8110)106141416543213500110000310123196000". To change the caption, use barCodeBuilder.CaptionAbove.Text = "company prefix + offer code";

member.summary: Encode mode of Datamatrix barcode, default to Auto

summary.para: Enable checksum during generation for 1D barcodes.
Default is treated as Yes for symbologies which must contain checksum, as No where checksum only possible.
Checksum never used: Codabar
Checksum is possible: Code39 Standard/Extended, Standard2of5, Interleaved2of5, Matrix2of5, ItalianPost25, DeutschePostIdentcode, DeutschePostLeitcode, VIN
Checksum always used: Rest symbologies

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.BarCodeElement.Pdf417CompactionMode
member.summary: Pdf417 symbology type of BarCode's compaction mode, default compaction mode is Auto

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.BarCodeElement.Pdf417ErrorLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets Pdf417 symbology type of BarCode's error coccrection level ranging from level0 to level8, level0 means no error correction info, level8 means best error correction which means a larger picture

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.BarCodeElement.Pdf417Truncate
member.summary: whether pdf417 symbology type of BarCode is truncated (to reduce space

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.BarCodeElement.PlanetShortBarHeight
member.summary: Short bar's height of Planet barcode, it has to be between 1 millimeter and 1.5 milimeters

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.BarCodeElement.PostnetShortBarHeight
member.summary: Short bar's height of Postnet barcode, it has to be between 1 millimeter and 1.5 milimeter (0.04 inch and 0.06 inch). To set up tall bar's height, see BarHeight, which has to be between 8.28 milimeter and 9.72 milimeter (0.115 inch and 0.135 inch)

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.BarCodeElement.PrinterName
member.summary: Choose printer, if not specified, Print() method will choose the first available printer

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.BarCodeElement.QREncodeMode
member.summary: QR symbology type of BarCode's encoding mode, default mode is Auto

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.BarCodeElement.QRErrorLevel
member.summary: Level of Reed-Solomon error correction for QR barcode. From low to high: LevelL, LevelM, LevelQ, LevelH

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.BarCodeElement.Resolution
member.summary: Gets or sets the resolution of the image

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.BarCodeElement.RotationAngleF
member.summary: BarCode image's rotation angle, measured in degree, e.g. RotationAngleF = 0 or RotationAngleF = 360 means no rotation. If RotationAngleF NOT equal to 90, 180, 270 or 0, it may increase the difficulty for the scanner to read the image, please set quality mode to anti-alias

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.BarCodeElement.Rows
member.summary: 2D BarCode's rows, if setting is illegal then rows will be calculated automatically. appliable Symbology: Pdf417

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.BarCodeElement.SupplementData
member.summary: Supplement data following BarCodes of symbology UPCA, UPCE, EAN13, EAN8, BooklandEAN, Interleaved2of5 or Standard2of5

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.BarCodeElement.SupplementSpace
member.summary: Space between main the BarCode and supplement BarCode, default Graphics Unit: millimeter

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.BarCodeElement.WideNarrowRatio
member.summary: Wide bars to Narrow bars ratio for some 1D BarCode. Appliable symbology: Code39Extended, Code39Standard, Standard2of5, Interleaved2of5

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.BarCodeElement.xDimension
member.summary: x-dimension, smallest width unit of BarCode's bars or spaces

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.WPF.BarCodeElement.yDimension
member.summary: y-dimension, smallest height unit of 2D BarCode's modules
